newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel-low sulphur eases with crude.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel-low sulphur eases with crude.

text.p: Low sulphur straight run material was seen a touch weaker as crude slid lower on Wednesday.

A couple of deals done earlier in the week at $135 cif NWE and $133 cif NWE were viewed as out of the ordinary - one forced deal was forced by problems at a UK refinery. Traders said the market eased back from these high levels and was closer to $123-124 fob NWE.
"I would expect it to get nearer $120 fob," said one trader. A handful of European refiners have cut crude runs which could boost buying, but no extra demand was seen.
High sulphur cargoes were assessed around formula +$5.
